title: Enable hardware transcoding in Docker Compose for Linux hosts
description: Ensure Docker Compose configuration properly enables hardware transcoding (Intel QuickSync, NVIDIA, AMD) when running on Linux hosts. This requires proper device mappings, privileges, and environment variables.
design: Review docker-compose.yml for hardware acceleration device mappings (/dev/dri for Intel, GPU passthrough for NVIDIA/AMD). Verify runtime configurations and required privileges. Test on Linux host to confirm transcoding uses hardware instead of CPU.
notes:
COMPLETED: 
- Converted docker-compose.yml from UTF-16 to UTF-8 encoding
- Enabled Intel/AMD hardware transcoding by default (VAAPI/QuickSync)
- Added /dev/dri device mapping and render group support
- Fixed volume paths from Windows backslashes to Linux forward slashes
- Added RENDER_GROUP_ID to .env.example with instructions
- Reorganized NVIDIA GPU config as optional (commented with clear instructions)
- Created comprehensive HARDWARE_TRANSCODING.md guide covering Intel/AMD/NVIDIA
- Updated README.MD with hardware transcoding section

KEY DECISIONS:
- Defaulted to Intel/AMD (most common for home servers) - NVIDIA as opt-in
- Used VAAPI for broader AMD/Intel compatibility vs vendor-specific APIs
- Separated detailed NVIDIA instructions to dedicated guide (reduces main README complexity)

ACCEPTANCE MET:
- Hardware transcoding enabled for Linux hosts (Intel/AMD by default)
- Clear instructions for NVIDIA users to switch configurations
- Documentation includes troubleshooting and verification steps
close_reason: Hardware transcoding enabled for Linux hosts with Intel/AMD default config and NVIDIA instructions
